sub_title: Community Librarian at Bibliotheek Venlo | PhD Candidate & Lecturer Religious Studies at Radboud University | Researcher & Writer
summary: “I believe that passion is the secret ingredient of the Philosopher’s Stone. Added are perseverance and a creative spirit to transform challenges into magical journeys. I live this wholeheartedly. My strengths are to think out-of-the-box and to diligently analyse complex questions with a critical mind. I am quality oriented and stress resistant, because only then can lead be transmuted into gold.”

awards.title: CeltCast Fantasy Award for Best Stand 2022
awards.description: Pagan Ways received the award for 'Best Stand 2022' based on public vote. The CeltCast Fantasy Awards honor contributors to the fantasy scene. The prizes are awarded during the annual liveshow in March at the start of the festival season. In 2023, the winners were: Best Song: The Dolmen - Shule Aroon, Best Album: Faun - Pagan, Best Live Act: Ye Banished Privateers, Best Photo: Rebecca Brown, Best Cover Art: Tovenaar (Robin Dekker) - SeeD Pagan Folk - FAE, Best Music Video: Heilung - Anoana, Best Stand: Pagan Ways, Best Festival: Zomerfolk - Groningen (NL), Best Venue: Peuterey Forest - Val Veny (IT) Celtica Valle d'Aosta, Best Monthly Marker: Sunfire - The Hourglass, Lifetime Achievement Award: Oliver Satyr (Faun).

contributors.headline: Community Librarian at Bibliotheek Venlo | PhD Candidate & Lecturer Religious Studies at Radboud University | Researcher & Writer

projects.title: Brilliant Assistants Seminar
projects.description:
'Culture, Religion and Memory' focuses explicitly on the historical and contemporary issues surrounding identity, religion and heritage in their mutual and dynamic relationship. It is concerned with how the past is created and transformed in the present. The aim of the CRM Brilliant Assistant programme is to make talented (research)master students passionate about conducting academic research. 
My project is titled: "Back to the Pagans! The perception of Germanic Pagans during the Romantic Era" and supervised by prof. dr. Daniela Müller. On 7 June 2013 I presented the paper 'Terug naar de Heidenen! De beeldvorming van Germaanse heidenen in het tijdperk van de Romantiek' at the Brilliant Assistant seminar.

projects.title: Honours Academy
projects.description:
The Honours Programmes of the Radboud Honours Academy are special supplementary programmes for highly motivated and outstanding Bachelor students wishing to deepen their theoretical and/or methodological knowledge of their own discipline. The programme is offered alongside the regular Bachelor's degree programme. The workload of each Honours Programme is at least 840 hours. Each programme is followed by an examination.

The Honours Academy consists of 
•	Extracurricular research on contemporary Paganism for the Bachelor thesis
•	Extracurricular course on criticism of religion and political order
•	Writing the paper Het Waanidee God: De religiekritiek in Richard Dawkins’s The God Delusion 
•	Studying an academic year abroad with the Erasmus Programme: Religious Studies, Celtic Studies and Archaeology at the University of Edinburgh in Scotland
•	Creating an interactive website
•	Presentation

Community Librarian at Bibliotheek Venlo | PhD Candidate & Lecturer Religious Studies at Radboud University | Researcher & Writer
Community Librarian at Bibliotheek Venlo | PhD Candidate & Lecturer Religious Studies at Radboud University | Researcher & Writer

profile_positions.description:
The role of Community Librarian is inspired by a theory developed by David Lankes, who states that "The mission of librarians is to improve society through facilitating knowledge creation in their communities." My community consists of (international) students in Venlo (mbo, hbo and wo). In collaboration with students, partners and colleagues, I develop, organize and facilitate inspiring (Bieb Inspireert) and connecting (Bieb Verbindt) activities, such as the 'Student Meet Up: Game Night' and the 'Shut Up & Write' study sessions. Bieb Werkt is the name of the reservation system for study and workstations at the library, and also the monthly newsletter for young people and students that I create in our CRM tool. 

Part of my role consist of 'traditional librarian' tasks and customer service at the main desk. For instance, I help library visitors with subscription, and with borrowing, returning, reserving and locating books. In the context of the 'Informatiepunt Digitale Overheid' (IDO), I assist guests with a wide range of questions they may have about the (digital) government, (social) institutions, and electronic devices. 

My previous role as Project Assistant at the library resulted in a close collaboration with the Communication Team, and an expansion of my CRM duties. The proceedings of the research I conducted in my former role resulted in the installment of a project team which aims for continuous growth. As part of this team, my tasks include research and data analysis for which I use various tools such as our CRM platforms. 

More information: 
- Student Agenda of Bibliotheek Venlo: https://bibliotheekvenlo.op-shop.nl/?tags%5B%5D=78
- #studentsofvenlo and (potential) partners: feel free to get in touch with me anytime if you share my mission!
profile_positions.title: Community Librarian for Students

profile_positions.description:
As a Project Assistant (Projectmedewerker), I am assigned to a research and improvement project for Bibliotheek Venlo. My tasks include project management, action planning, multi-method research, data analysis, critical assessment of internal tools, reporting, and providing advice. 

The project assignment is to use a mixed-method approach (quantitative data analysis and qualitative research) to map the target audience in the smaller locations of the Library Venlo (the 'Kernen' Arcen, Belfeld, Blerick, Tegelen, and Velden), and to give advice on a successful rollout of the programs and activities of the City Library to these 'Kernen'. The ProBiblio Business Model Canvas was used to create a business plan for this aim. The project resulted in presentations of the findings to multiple teams (Director, Leads of Public Services and Programs, Business Services, Communication, and Community Librarians), and two business and marketing plans (a Community Librarian version, and a Communication version). 

The research and its findings have been a stepping stone to further explore the opportunities in the form of a project team of which I am a member.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As an external PhD candidate at the chair of History of Christianity (Faculty of Philosophy, Theology and Religious Studies) at the Radboud University Nijmegen, I am doing research on the German Romantic roots of contemporary Paganism. Occasionally, I give lectures on this and related subjects. 
- https://www.ru.nl/english/people/schattevoet-y
- https://www.ru.nl/ftr/onderzoek/promotieonderzoek/vm-lopende-promoties/phd-candidates-present-their-research/
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate Religious Studies

profile_positions.description:
Lecturer of the Religious Studies Master Seminar History of Christianity (FTR-RSMAR104): ‘De Herbetoverende Wereld van Occulture’ at Radboud University, Nijmegen (The Netherlands), Semester 1, 2022-2023. 

The Master course can be found in the Course Catalog: https://www.ru.nl/osiris-student/OnderwijsCatalogusSelect.do?selectie=cursus&taal=nl&collegejaar=2022&cursus=FTR-RSMAR104#

Course Description: De Herbetoverende Wereld van Occulture
Tijdens deze cursus behandelen we uitvoerig de herbetoverende wereld van occulture door nieuwe religieuze identiteiten – in interactie met, en als alternatief voor het dominante christelijke en/of wetenschappelijke wereldbeeld – in hun historische en hedendaagse context te bestuderen. Aan de hand van de theoretische concepten occulture, herbetovering, invention of tradition, perceptie en de wisselwerking tussen toeschrijving en toe-eigening onderzoeken we de verbeelding van de geschiedenis en de toenemende popularisering van magische denkbeelden vanaf de Romantiek. We gaan dieper in op religieuze identiteitsvorming binnen de moderne magie van de 'Westerse Esoterische Traditie', New Age spiritualiteit, hekserij en Wicca, het hedendaags Paganisme en aanverwante religieuze stromingen. Aan het einde van deze cursus begrijpen we de zoektocht van de moderne mens naar een authentieke religieuze identiteit beter en zullen we het ontstaan van nieuwe religieuze bewegingen kritisch kunnen evalueren.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
Wyldernys creates content on occultural religion, spirituality and magic, grounded in academic knowledge and spirited by higher wisdom. We share our content with a community of likeminded people to live a meaningful and magical life.

As the Founder, Owner and Content Creator, I am the driving force behind Wyldernys, which is rooted in my academic expertise and personal fascination for alternative religion and spirituality - most notably contemporary Paganism and the Western Esoteric Tradition.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Owner and Content Creator

profile_positions.description:
Providing a unique and tailored musical experience as a kilt-wearing Scottish bagpipe player at events, festivals and special occasions, and giving bagpipe lessons as a tutor. Performed with André Rieu and the Johann Strauss Orchestra, Rowwen Hèze, Летците, among others. Annual performances for the British Ambassy in Bulgaria, and was live on the popular Bulgarian television show Na Kafe in January 2022.

Bands: 
+ 2005-2016: Venlo Caledonian Pipe Band (previously MacLaren Pipe Band), the Netherlands (grade 4)
+ 2010-2011: Stockbridge Pipe Band, Scotland (grade 4)
+ 2009-2011: Valknut, the Netherlands (pagan folk metal)

Competitions & Prizes: 
+ See https://www.facebook.com/dreadlockpiper/ for a list. 

+ Website: https://kultovyentl.wordpress.com/doedelzak/
+ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dreadlockpiper/ (200+ likes)
+ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPg3bnBydP9t9sC5hcUxzxw

@dreadlockpiper

profile_positions.description:
As the manager of the Quality Assurance team, my responsibilities are to ensure top notch quality of our customer support (multiple LOBs: email, web messaging, social media, Spotify Community, and Ad Studio) by improving and developing efficient and effective continuous improvement plans, action plans, customer journey maps, quality assurance processes and the like, monitoring and analyzing metrics on a team and site level to provide insightful reports, collaborating with multiple stakeholders to improve our site's performance, leading, auditing and coaching a team of motivated Quality Assurance Specialists, and conducting job interviews. 
Tools: Tableau, Google Sheets, Google Slides, Excel, Jira, Guru, SalesForce, LivePerson, Fanbase, Adyen, OneSource, PayPal, and various internal Sutherland tools. 

Additional projects:
+ Mavericks Team (global feedback and advice team), since 2020
profile_positions.title: Quality Assurance Lead for Spotify CS

profile_positions.description:
Senior QA from October 2021 onwards. 
Ensuring top notch quality of the work of Spotify's global GS3 Team, which is the highest level of customer support. This GS3 or Executive Team handles escalated email cases that require specialized attention such as technical troubleshooting and legal clarification. My tasks include auditing emails, DSAT scrubbing, data analysis, spotting trends and behavioral opportunities, reporting results and insights, providing feedback to both Team Leads and the client, and creating data-driven action plans for continuous people, product and process improvement. It is my aim to motivate my team of dedicated GS3 advisors from across the globe to excel in providing the best customer experience. 
Tools: Guru, SalesForce, LivePerson, Fanbase, Jira, Tableau, Adyen, OneSource, and PayPal.

Additional projects:
+ Mavericks Team (global feedback and advice team), since 2020

Prizes, awards, and certificates:
+ Behavior Excellence Award, August 2021
